summary: Through its Paycheck Protection Program and Economic Injury Disaster Loans, the Small Business Administration has provided about $729 billion to small businesses hurt by COVID-19 . SBA streamlined the programs to speed fund distribution. However, this meant less oversight and left the programs more susceptible to potential fraud. There have been reports of fraud in both programs. This testimony discusses the need to identify and...
title: Small Business Administration: COVID-19 Loans Lack Controls and Are Susceptible to Fraud
